intro: Corydalis latiloba var. tibetica, commonly known as the Tibetan broadleaf corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
